ofx:section.ofx:title: PostgresSQL
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: The RDBMS PostgreSQL is shipped with several command line tools for backups and restores of tables and databases. All of these tools can be executed on the command line and it's easily possible to automate these procedures. The backups should be executed by the system user postgres who has the appropriate rights for accessing the database.
First of all the target directories for the database dumps and the shell scripts need to be created:

The database dump is created by the pgdump command line tool. To automate the process, the parameters of the tool are defined in a shell script which can be executed manually or automatically by the cron daemon.
